citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The licensee refused to allow an APHIS official access to the premises for an unannounced routine inspection on May 3,
2023. The inspector arrived at the facility at approximately 10:50 am. The licensee was outside on a utility vehicle at the
time of arrival. The inspector exited her vehicle, introduced herself as a VMO inspector and stated she was there to
conduct a routine inspection. The licensee stated that it was not a good day and asked if the inspector could return later.
The inspector explained that this was a routine unannounced inspection, and that Animal Care does not schedule
inspections other than initial licensing and relicensing inspections. The inspector also explained the serious nature of
inspection refusal. The licensee became irate and stated he was fed up with the USDA and wanted to cancel his license.
The Inspector explained the cancelation process and promptly left the facility.
Allowing inspectors to conduct inspections is a requirement of all licensed facilities under the Animal Welfare Act.
Refusing inspection inhibits the regulatory process and prevents inspectors from assessing animal health and welfare and
prevents the Secretary from fulfilling his obligation to enforce the Animal Welfare Act. This non-compliant item can be
corrected by allowing inspectors to conduct inspections during normal business hours without refusal of the inspection
process by the licensee.
Correct immediately.
An inspection and exit interview were not conducted with the licensee.
